page.title: 02RECREATION GROUND AT MAULDEN
page.content: The{recreation ground}can be found in Maulden. There are benches,football pitches,swings,slides,sandpits and two tubular constructions for variety of climbing and the usual climbing frame and there is a separate playing patch for toddlers,including special{play_ {ground}equipment. Its away from the main road.It is in a safe position surrounded by trees.Cyclists and dogs are only allowed around the edge.There is only one bad point which is there's only one dustbin.The ground is 40_50 years old and was a cricket ground which belonged to a charity (trust). It was later given to the community. At Maulden there are{Allotments where they grow cauliflowers and lettuces .Summerfield belonged to a man who owned Wingfield House.Llammas were kept on fields nearby.These were owned by Bert Summerfield.
